After eating we wanted to go do some Christmas shopping, but was unable to continue as I got severe cramps and gas after having the Angel hair shrimp dish.  We also had the baked ziti which was quite underwhelming.  We've gone hear a number of times, however I think that was our last sorry to say.  :-(

Cannot state enough reasons why you should try this wonderful restaurant. Amazing food, great atmosphere, cool bar and warm welcome. Give it a try, you will not be disappointed. See owner Greg, great owner.
The most authentic homemade Italian food in the valley... fresh homemade bread , hand-tossed pizzas. Beautiful patio seating area

I moved here to Phoenix from a city that is well known for it's Italian neighborhoods and Italian food.  The first thing I missed when I had been here a month or 2 was good Italian food.  There are plenty of people that have claimed they found good Italian food here or there, but when I tried it, i found the places were serving something that may have included pasta, but had nothing else in common with Italy... so now after years of searching to find really good Italian food in the Phoenix area,  I can count all the really good places on one hand...  Il Posto is one of them.  In addition, it is a very reasonably priced place with a wonderful patio.  Their eggplant parmigiana is some of the best I have ever had.  The layers of eggplant are thin and perfectly crispy before they bake the whole thing in cheese and sauce.  The pasta on the side has a wonderful light fresh marinara.  Their scampi sauce is garlicky, but not too much.... and their Alfredo is made per order with the best cream, butter and cheese.  It's so rich that I have to limit myself to a once a year thing when I order their tortellini.  For lunch, try a Caesar salad, or a paninni.  This is one place where you don't have to explain what you mean if you want a white pizza.  It's already on the menu.    The patio is well placed and has fountains and plants to keep away all parking lot noise.  The decorations are fun and endearing to people who have spent any time in NYC's little Italy.... right down to the painted Mulberry Street sign and the laundry hanging on the lines overhead.  Now, I hear they have rented the storefront that is immediately east of their place and are opening a bar called "the lounge."  I hope it will be as fun to go there as it has been to sit at the bar on their patio.  I will be thrilled to have another neighborhood hangout.

We can't get enough of this local Italian gem.  Every dish reminds of us Italy and tastes like the best dishes Mama made. Don't leave here without trying the Salmon,  Eggplant Parmesan, Chicken Piccata, or Zucca de Pesce.

Was trying to find a place for dinner and Ziggy's IL Posto's came up. The food in the picture looked pretty good so we decided to give it a shot! The owner was wonderful. Very friendly and kind. They were able to make my husband something that wasn't on the menu! Their hot wing oh my goodness are one of a kind!! AMAZING!! You can taste the difference right off the bat. The pizza... you can taste the time put into making the dough and baking the pizza, not your average pizza!! The cannoli's was a great dessert to the night! Highly recommend!!!
Oh my gosh you need to eat here. So fricken delicious. I had the baked tortellini and I basically destroyed it. I'll be back to try more.

What a wonderful little treasure to discover.  With a great personality and a versatile menu, Ziggys is a great place to spend an evening. From the wonderful homemade bread served before dinner to the excellent flavors of all 4 dishes ordered we had not one complaint. They have a good beer and wine selection and even offer entertainment. So if you are looking for a nice evening out, this is the place for you.
Great family. Great history in the valley. Great authentic Italian. Great speak easy with wonderful live music. The court yard is spectacular.

Just stopped in here on Friday night for the first time   We were visiting a dear friend at the hospital right by there !!!  I cannot tell you all enough to come try this place , since I've moved here 10 years ago I haven't had this wonderful of food unless I made it myself!!!!  All of the staff was wonderful but We LOVE LOVE LOVE  MELANIE THE BARTENDER, she was so sweet and gave us good suggestions of things to try !!!  Thank you Melanie for being so great !!

Yelp rocks. Without it we wouldn't have tried this place.   Started with the capresse appetizer and the stuffed mushrooms. The basaltic glaze and fresh black pepper were perfect. The mushrooms had and great taste and yummy cheese.   I had the special, chicken princessa. A great blend of lemon artichoke hearts roasted red pepper over fettuccine. Very very tasty. My man had the spaghetti with meat sauce. The sauce was hearty and very yummy.   Cheesecake for desert.   We will return. It's so good and close. Yay.

The Thai Chicken pizza is good. But the white NY pizza is not good at all frozen spinach on the pizza we can do better than that.! The apple salad with mixed greens was good. We were not impressed at all .

3 1/2 Stars  Alright, I'll try and make this one short and sweet and follow the old expression "If you don't have anything nice to say..." because I really did like parts of Il Posto...  Let me start by saying that the staff was incredible!  About 20 or so of us Yelpers gathered yesterday for a Happy Hour organized by the fantastic Christina P and the staffers were very pleased to oblige.  Like Bacon B said before me, I'm always nervous about being a part of a large party because it is practically inevitable that they are going to screw up at least some of our orders, and it is guaranteed that mine will always be one of them.  That said this was sooo not the case here.  I was shocked!  We sat outside and were all served at our leisure by 1 bartender who I from here on out will refer to as Superman, because he obviously had some sort of magical powers to serve all 20 of us individually, simultaneously, and screwed up no one's orders mind you...  I'll continue to touch on the good.  The patio was great.  Very spacious area with a fire pit in the middle which added some lovely ambiance to the evening, and hey, who doesn't look better by firelight??   Now on to the less than good...  The Happy Hour specials were okay, to be honest I'm not thrilled by $1 off of things, I think it's kind of weak.  However, many of Il Posto's drink prices were already fairly low, so the $1 off could sway some.  First of all, I will say that their fresh bread and pesto dip which was free mind you was delicious.  The pizza though, not so much...Let me preface this by saying that I am from NYC and I take my pizza very seriously...it is a bit of an art for me  I don't want to say too much because I do want to go back and try some different things because the rest of the experience was lovely, but no, unfortunately, I did not enjoy my pizza.  It was undercooked, the dough was unimpressive, and I had to use a knife and fork because it was so soggy.  All in all I had a nice time at Il Posto, mainly because of the company, but I would be willing to go back and give it another shot.

Was driving on 7th Street through North Mountain park when Il Posto caught my eye. After meeting up with my "little" brother, I decided to take him to dinner there and check the place out.  Ambience: old world Italy mixed with Lady and the Tramp and a pizza joint. The patio is lovely, especially at dusk and in the evening, and was the popular place to sit. Try and get seated near the firepit if possible, as their portable heaters appear to be out. Reservations accepted (that's why we weren't able to sit near the firepit).  Service: below what I expected though not below average. Our server took quite a long time to take our order and also took a long time to bring out another basket of bread. There's also like, 3 separate menus: one for drinks, one for pizzas and one for the rest of the food.  Food: I ordered the mussels appetizer, but requested that they cook it in a white wine sauce, as opposed to the marinara/basil sauce offered on the menu. They obliged. It was pretty tasty, though some of the mussels were overcooked and very tough to get out of the shell. My brother ordered chicken alfredo (wah wah) and surprise, was not that impressed with it; he claims it was bland and tasteless.   Price:  both of our meals were in the $12-15 range, a fair price considering the large portions. I didn't finish mine and my brother took half of his home.  For best success: reserve a table for 6PM near the firepit on the patio, bring a smokin' hot date and share a big bottle of their finest wine. And their delicious pesto/olive oil mixture with a basket of hot bread.... molto bene!

Had dinner at Ziggy's on 7th street and Mountainview with some good friends last evening.  We sat on the patio and it was just so pleasant. The food was delicious and the service was excellent.  Our waitress; Taylor, was delightful; friendly and professional the same time. I recommend this restaurant to all my friends and family. Try it out. You will not be disappointed!
We loved the patio almost as much as the pizza. The staff was very friendly too. I can't wait to go back. A great little find in this area.

I like this restaurant a lot and dine here every couple of months.  The patio with the Italian villa decor is charming and I love the firepit. This restaurant is were I take out of state guests because the food is so good. The fresh made pesto and warm bread is excellent.  I've tried numerous selections from the menu and I've never been disappointed. The spagetti carbonara is my favorite. They've taken it off the menu but will still make it. The veal scallopine, when they have it as a special is also very good . It's layered with mozzarella cheese and eggplant..  The service is good and so are the prices.

Il Posto is a restaurant my husband and I frequent after we moved into the Moon Valley area. The outside patio is cozy especially when the fire is burning and the weather is chilly, combine that with a nice bottle of red wine and it creates a warm and comfortable ambience.   Last Friday's dinner the atmosphere was just right, the sounds of cutlery, dinner chatter and my husband and I were gearing up to enjoy our favorite, the seafood house special and meat lasagna-until we learned the restaurant had been sold. Our experience with our server Devon was hands down the best yet we were leery of the change. As patrons we questioned the intentions of the new owner and we were doubtful, but by the end of the evening we had a change of heart.   The new restaurant owner, Executive Chef 'Ziggy' was wearing a maroon colored, double-breasted culinary jacket, he appeared fresh-faced and excited and his energy exuded charisma. I watched him crank up the fire pit to enhance our dinner experience and to our delight he suggested background music which we definitely agreed. He also expressed fresh ideas yet maintain the winning menu with a few tweaks here and there and even attested to staying faithful to the true character of "her" meaning the restaurant, as he looked around at his new haven.   Immediately, we took a liking to him especially as we watched him in action with the guests. He was courteous and welcoming from young to old, he demonstrated genuine appreciation for the patrons and reminded folks to sit down and relax. After all, that's why we come out to dinner right?  Needless to say, we enjoyed our experience that night and felt the future of Il Posto will not only continue to thrive but exceed success. We are excited and ready for the fresh energy and the few new faces, yet experience the same great Italian food on planet earth. This is a must try-period.

What a find. 5 years in PHX and never knew of this place. First it's big! Way bigger than it looks from outside. The patio is wonderful, inside dining room is good and the lounge is great. Had dinner at a high top in the lounge. Mussels Marinara was just perfect with good garlic bread for dipping. Grilled shrimp over pasta was good not great. Little did we know that at 8 a live combo starts playing. It was mo town night. So much fun. A lively if older crowd. Headed back on a Saturday for Jazz. Love this new find!!

So I just moved to Phoenix and have been tasting about town. Don't get me wrong, Il Posto isn't going to blow you away with tastes you never dreamed possible...but for the friendly service and reasonable prices it's worth it alone!  Then the food comes! Awesome portion for a great price. Makes you feel like you are at your favorite relatives house for dinner. House made pesto is delish too! I will definitely be returning.

Brunch was one of the worst experienced. over-priced ($18 per person) and just off. a mimosa served in a tumbler filled with ice? lame. mimosas come in a flute, period. Euro- styled pancake was thin chewy and better off as a frisbee. Mexican scramble on tortillas was disappointing. I was hoping for something resembling huevos rancheros but was left with dry scrambled eggs on dry tortillas. the cheese was mildly flavored and the salsa did have a kick but not enough to make the dish. never again. this place while trying to be different failed. top it off, the waitress was annoying and ditzy. meanwhile, Scramble next door had a long line almost out the door.

Food is awesome. Idle servers, hostess and bartender socialize, eat and check cell phones in full view of customers. Busboy was the only one hustling; everyone else was just killing time in between service. Totally lacking in professionalism. Hostess chewing & snapping gum with a bored attitude. Wouldn't go back except I have another restaurant.com GC.

Quite possibly the worst steak I have ever been served. I ordered it medium, it came out bloody and I sent it back. After 20 minutes they brought it back and it was charred. It was so chewy and tough I couldn't finish two bites. Horrible. The server was incredibly slow and inattentive.   I may have a drink on the patio some day, but I will not eat at this place again.

Tonight was my third visit to il Posto and I have not been disappointed.  All the food I have gotten has been very good. Tonight I had the apple-arugula salad topped with chicken. I have had their gnocchi, eggplant rollatini, pasta with sausage, etc. and all has been good. Sitting inside is a very different experience than sitting outside; tonight there was no outside seating so we were forced indoors and the experience was not as good. I highly suggest outdoors if possible. The servers are usually young kids who don't have much experience, so don't expect a lot in that department. But the food is great, as is the ambiance.

Went to Arizona bike week in April of this year, and were there for 4 nights. We ate at this place 3 out of the 4 nights for dinner! It was AMAZING!!! Please come to Costa Mesa California!!! We LOVE Ziggy's!!! The Scampi, the Pizza, the Salmon!! OH MY GOSH!!  Thank you to the wonderful wait staff, who knew the 3 of us by the time we left. :) See you next year!!

Overall, a great experience! The only negative is the speed in which we receive our food it took about 45 minutes to get our food. There were eight of us and I did not hear why it was so slow. It didn't seem that busy.      Now with the negative out of the way so many Great things. Ed, manager was wonderful, our server short haired female girl wonderful very very good server!! I loved it I had gluten-free pizza it had good cheese fresh basil big mushrooms and sausage. They start you with bread it was amazing and warm great pesto butter. We had everything from Caesar salad to basic spaghetti and meatballs and piccata chicken with an amazing sauce.      I really enjoyed the atmosphere it had low lighting good combination of decor and different entertainment each night they had an outdoor court and beautiful seating outside.      They had a great variety of wines in a good bar it was a great celebration place for our October birthdays!

I liked it. We requested an outdoor patio table..so charming! Just like the other reviews, it resembles a little cafe. I wouldn't say authentic, but a cute attempt at making you feel away from the city. The firepit was also a great touch outside. The bread and pesto was great and very flavorful. The menu, as MOST Italian restaurants done on the West coast, lacks authenticity. It seemed bare. Not bare enough for me to not want to leave, just lacking the stuff I want to see from NY/NJ menus. I had the margherita pizza..tasty, not too greasy, and a nice crust. I requested light on the plum tomatoes-perfect. My husband had the jalapeno chicken pizza..it was HOT!!!  Adorable ambiance, and decent food. Not bad all.

Have been here before and the food is great. Decided to go last Saturday.  Patio was a little busy and I guess the lounge was as well. They do have live music .  We decided to sit inside dining.  Tables were not cleaned off... we'll wait.  Cleaned a booth for us.... keep in mind... inside was empty... but it appeared they were expecting a big party ( tables pushed together for about 20) Not a server in sight now.  Finally got water. One glass gone. Water refill. 2 glasses gone.  Finally a server. Yes... I'd like a cocktail... husband ordered a bottle of wine.  3 glasses of water done.  Wine comes...no cocktail. Server must have said 6 Times... I'll check on that drink. Ugh.  She also said we better order because big party is starting to come in. Gee okay. Thought I'd enjoy my drink before I order food... but sure.  We ordered the salad for 2. And I preferred the eggplant rollintini ( appetizer) I know it's huge.  Husband ordered specialty pasta with sausage.  Bread arrives. No cocktail. Well I might as well drink some wine. ( she did bring 2 glasses).  More water.  Finally she brings the drink. Kind of lose my interest in it because I had started on the wine already.  Then..... ( its easily been an hour)... she comes over and says.... I forgot what you ordered. I write it down but I don't know where I put it.  We did have our salad by then... Thankfully.  She was very nice... but come on... really?  As my photo will show... before the party came in.... we were the only ones in the dining room.  Food is so good... but tonight.... yeah... the service made me mad. Took most of it home.  Bill came.... I thought really? That drink should have been complimentary. Nope. Ugh.  I know I'll be back.... and hope they have stepped up their

I was really impressed with Il Posto, especially after all of the mediocre reviews. My favorite Yelper, Christina P, put together a UYE here last night, and the event could not have been more perfect.  The bartender and staff were really friendly and made us feel very welcome. They have a fantastic patio with a fire pit in the middle which made for a perfect happy hour setting.  We happened to be there on the night they unveiled their specialty pizza line. I had the pleasure of trying both the margharita and the goat cheese & onion, both of which I thought were fantastic. They also serve bread with a cheesy pesto dipping sauce that was to die for.  Our group ending up trying a lot of different pizza's and everyone seemed to really enjoy.  I was pleased with their happy hour specials ($2 off specialty pizzas; $1 off appetizers, well drinks, house wines and draft beers) and especially pleased that they extended those specials for our group for the entire time we were there.  This is another time I wish we could give 1/2 stars because I would give Il Posto a 4.5... and I will definitely be back to grab another glass of the Chateau Ste. Michelle Riesling and snack on one of those delish speciality pizza's on the patio!
We were thankful that the restaurant was open till 10. But the pizza is fairly greasy and a little over priced.
Zupa di pesch was phenom!
Great food and service.  Good local spot!

Extreme slow service!! It took them more then 40 min to get our food.. it was only us and one other table and one pick up order.. the food was good when it finally came out.. but they can use one more chef and one more waiter..

These guys are class act. Waited and waited and they kept looking and nobody came to offer a seat. The sign clearly said wait to be seated. I'd give them -5 if I could. YES they saw me. They just kept talking in Spanish.  Wow. Good job guys. Hope management is proud of you.

I absolutely love the food here, one of my new favorite places for food.  Unfortunately, they need more help.  Ate their this last Sunday and only one server for outside patio.  She was tied up with a large party.  Took forever to get drinks, had to ask for silver ware.  The food when it came out, though, was scumptious! Had the lasagna, chicken picatta and eggplant parmesan.

This has become our favorite Italian restaurant.  Since we are Italian we are somewhat picky and Ziggy's gets it done!  We typically order chicken or pasta dishes and they never disappoint.  The bread is fresh with garlic/herb butter.  The primavera on angel hair with either chicken or shrimp is garlic heaven and delicious.  A relative told me it was the best Bolognese they ever had.  We take our out of town guests there.  It is quiet and the service is extra friendly.  Lounge next door with live music.

My husband and I had dinner at Il Posto while visiting Phoenix. Dinner was great, service was perfect. Our waitress was super nice and right on top of our needs. I wish it was a bit warmer I would have like to sit outside on the patio.

We visited Il Posto for the second time this past Sunday evening.  This was our second experience with the same server.  He was very inattentive and seemed as though he did not want to be there.  We had to flag him down when we needed anything such as more drinks and bread because he never came around after taking our initial order.  The restaurant seems to be ran by a bunch of young people and no management was present.  The restaurant was dusty and there were flies and gnats everywhere.  The food was mediocre at best.  We will not be visiting Il Posto again.

We have driven pass The Lounge numerous times wanting to give it a try. Then I noticed Ziggy's was attached. We finally reserved our dinner and it was one of our best evenings out since we moved to  Phoenix 2 tears ago. Dillon was a fabulous- the owners I assumed made sure we were well taken care of. The food was quality, top notch! We went into the lounge after dinner...great seating, service was great and the band was so much fun. Definately will be back!!

I dont think the owner is very friendly.. I think the hours are kinda odd... Staff could be a little bit more excited to work there... Food is okay.. Pizza is good... Salad is bland, I could deff whip up something better at home. I love the pesto. Love the patio :)

Took my husband to Ziggys tonight for a birthday dinner. The decor was dingy and old with higher end prices. The food was bland and disappointing. We refused to eat it and walked out. We are now at Babbo's having a great meal with good service.

I'm assuming everyone was there for the Smart Shopper deal for 1/2 off menu items excluded the drinks and desserts.  It was a busy Friday night.  We seat by the open kitchen.  Every dish looked and smelled so good.  We got to watch the Suns vs. Lakers game on nice big screen TV.  The kids enjoyed the Chefs cooking, especially when the pans were on fire.  I had tried their White Wine Flight (InfmGoose  - Sauvignon Blac, New Age White, and NapaCreek Chard) - $9.00.  I like the flight, however the New Age White was over ice, and it was sort of diluted.  I'm glad that we ordered the appetizers crab cakes and soup/salad.  The clam chowder was full with crabs, so worth the $2.00 add-on to your meal.  I think they forgot us after the appetizers.  Our food took a while to arrive.  After sitting for about 15-20 minutes, our food finally arrived.  I had ordered the Four Seasons pizza that came with 2 slices of the seafood (scallop/shrimp), margherita, mushroom & plum tomatoes, and prosciutto with shaved parmesan.  The seafood pizza needs cheese and sauce.  It was basically scallop and shrimp on a pita bread.  The rest of the pizza was just OK. They do have excellent paste dishes.   My friends had the Seafood Manicotti, Linguini with clam, and another pasta dish, which I can't remember the name.  They were all phenomenal.  The Chicken Marsala was a bit dry.  As the weather cools, they have a great patio area to unwind.
Tried it for the 1st time, and it was sooo delicious! We loved it! We will definitely order again soon!
It is great that the place is in the neighborhood. It is just sad that it is nothing special. The only reason we go is because it is convenient.  The staff are always nice.

This review could have gone a very different way this evening....  We live in the area and love supporting local restaurants. Better food, unique experiences. We tried out Ziggy's for the first time tonight.  My review tonight may have ended with a 1 star review. The service was very poor. Perhaps a new waitress. Perhaps a little understaffed. But regardless, it was poor. We placed our order. Appetizer came out a tad slow, but not noteworthy. Bruschetta. Very good. Crisp, fresh crostini with a tomato/basil/Parmesan topping that obviously was made with a lot of love and care.   However, our entrees took forever. Almost 45 minutes after ordering, I approached the counter where I could see that "Ziggy" himself was running the pizza oven. I commented to him as constructively as I could that we had been waiting a long time and that nobody was really taking care of us. He apologized sincerely. I realized at this moment that our pizzas had not even been made yet or placed in the oven. He assured me that I would be next up.  Now, the pizza itself was extremely good. Perfect chewy crust with a crisp slightly burnt exterior. Not sure if they pull their own mozzarella or not, but it tasted extremely fresh. However, no pizza is worth waiting nearly an hour to receive during a dine in visit. This review gets 5 stars because of how the chef treated us. He made the bill right with us (least of my concern), came and set with us several times to discuss our satisfaction and the struggle of the evening in the restaurant. He was pleasant, didn't react negatively to the experience and stressed the importance that repeat customers are his priority in running the joint.   The food itself deserved 5 stars and while the service itself started out miserable, the chef/owner really saved the day and assured we will come back and give the service a second try. The food and care by the owner earned them as much!

Their outdoor patio is a plus here, which is nicely decorated in an old world italian theme. Go when you can sit outside. Great menu variety and the food was decent. Pretty bad service, however, though they were apparently short staffed the night we visited. I'd give them another try.
Great, attentive and welcoming staff, great food, good prices, great location. One of our "go-to" in terms of Italian and gives me the old New York being from there originally.

Ziggy's has the BEST Italian food and the customer service is phenomenal. In addition, the owners are personable, good people. They have a beautiful outdoor seating area...the atmosphere is a fun, family place. I would suggest this place to anyone!

This is tough.  Found this place via restaurant.com so we decided to check it out. Place appears to be a cute little mom and pop shop, we walked in shortly after 830 on a Saturday so it was an hour and a half  before closing.  The hostess was super nice and sat us right down and said the waitress would be with us soon. A long while passed and it took a reminder and apology from the hostess, but our waitress finally stopped talking with the other waiter long enough to come take our drink and food order.  While we were waiting for the food to come the real show started.......the waiter was coming in and out of the back to the waitress station eating what appeared to be chicken wings, our waitress and the hostess sat down at a table and shared a plate of pasta, and the most concerning item was the bar tender from the lounge side.   He came over to pick up a salad and as he has the customers salad in his one hand, he's sucking on his e cigarette with his other hand. I tried to grab my phone to catch this but he quickly walked back to the other side with the salad.  When he came back to the kitchen he was waiting for a pizza in the pizza oven and the was running his hands through his hair and rubbing his nose, then handled the pizza. Gross!!!!  Then the food came and somehow it made all the horrible service worth it.  It was amazingly delicious.  We had 3 dinners, an appetizer, and a dessert and all of them were perfect.  The 4 men in the kitchen working totally made up for the 4 slackers working the front of the house.  I would say if you like waffle house, you will love this place because based on the front, service, and sanitation habits of the front of the house, I would rate it a 1 star. If you base it on the food alone I would give it 5 stars.  If you can ignore poor service for good food, give it a try.

For those wondering, the restaurant.com coupons work fine, however the incompetent staff at Il Posto couldn't and/or wouldn't figure out 18% for the included gratuity.  The coupon clearly states that it would be included, so no surprise there..... ...but a big WTF when I realized looking at the receipt that they had either purposefully or accidentally calculated exactly 20% as the autogratuity.  Now by saying it may have been an accident, I'm really pushing things and trying to be nice because I overall liked the place.  I cannot honestly come up with an explanation as to how a person who'd graduated 4th grade math could read a peice of paper saying 18% and then calculate 20%, unless is was blatantly done on purpose with the idea that the customer wasn't going to figure it out.  SHAME SHAME SHAME  The decor here is a mish-mash of old and new, good and bad, nice and ugly.  They've recently done (some) remodeling, since I saw a huge dumpster in the parking lot, but they aren't finished inside.  There are huge areas where exposed surfaces are in need of paint or drywall, and a huge sheet of plastic hung in a doorway behind us, swooshing with every breeze of a server walking by. The outside patio area did indeed look very neato, like a street in italy or new york.  Inside, they have a dining area with warm wood accents, a lit-up fountain, and dim lighting (which i liked, but the mrs said was making her feel woozy) right next to the kitchen area's flourescent light fixtures and flourescent lime green paint.  What classiness the first area had was lost with barely a shift of your glance, since there's no wall or anything separating the two areas. The very uncomfortable booths have hard wood back and a butt cushion that's token at best, with the bottom of the seat being way too long, so your back can't reach the seatback so you are forced to chose between sitting upright with no backrest at all, or slouching so badly that a painful arch is in your middle back.  The food had good and bad, as well.  The bread basket with pesto dip was superb, and like many others have said, we should've simply eaten that until full and then left.    The lady's ceviche was a huge portion, and said to be very good (didn't eat it), but the tortillas I did sample were overcooked, looking only slightly dark but tasting burnt.  My NY strip pizziaola - after being ordered as "tell the chef to aim for between Medium and Medium Rare" - arrived at barely even MR, but was tasty enough with all that garlicy marinara (*SLICES* of shaved garlic, like in Goodfellas!) that the extra juiciness was okay with me.  I used more of the appetizer bread to soak up the bloodiness.  Mmmmm aus juis  The other had a penne dish with chicken and mushrooms in a brown sauce.  This was said to be all just fine, but my keen eye saw the chicken going untouched and a few peices of penne being pushed around.  Probing proved that all was not just fine, since the chicken was quite dry, and the penne was so barely grasping to reach al dente doneness that she thought at first it might be whole wheat pasta (the dim lighting may have contributed also).  Service was 'eh'.  Yes, that's right.  It was so generic, by-the-book, make sure we cover all the requisite phrases and checking in moments -- but nothing more than that -- that I cannot even warrant the "M" to give them the entire 'meh'.    When inquiring if we'd like wine, and asked for Spumante, the server replied, "you mean Spumoni?!? We don't have that." We looked at each other.....I so badly wanted to ask "so, you don't have the wine, or you don't have the ice cream?"....but we both just gave a tentative "okaaaaaaay..."    Chose not to try getting any wine.   8^ |  There was nothing too horrible about the service, but nothing great either......  EXCEPT of course there was the fact that someone involved in making up the bill decided to _*help themselves*_ to a 20% gratuity when the coupon states that an 18% gratuity is included.  Even with the mediocre service, I would have added a personal table tip to the auto-gratuity, but I certainly did not do that once I saw the 20% on the bill. I also chose not to bring it up with the server, because it was obvious that they already knew that it was calculated at 20%, and I wasn't about to play the whole Pretend It Was An Error game. There was no mis-reading the coupon. There was no mistake in the math. It was *calculated* at exactly 20% with intention. So that's what they got from me.  Nothing else.  ...except this review.

Went on a random Thursday night.  It seems like the owners have a stake in all of the restaurants/bars in the same shopping center.    Didn't realize how cute the outside patio was, or I would have chosen to sit there.  Ordered calamari appetizer - best part of the meal.   Entree - seafood manicotti.  I try to stray away from fish with cheese, but this was really, the fish tasted fresh, and i did not feel disgustingly full after.   Overall, a nice little italian place, but nothing to go home bragging about

I had such a great time at Il Posto!  We came here for dinner.  The weather was nice so we sat on the patio.  I love the ambience of their outdoor space.  It's like you're at a cafe in Little Italy.  They start you off with warm crusty bread and served with the most delicious dipping sauce.  It was olive oil with pesto and garlic.  So good!  For appetizers we ordered calamari and the seafood fra diavolo.  If you can handle a little heat I highly recommend the seafood fra diavolo.  It's calamari and shrimp in a spicy marinara sauce.  It's served with grilled bread for dipping.  It's out of this world!  For my main dish I had the cheese manicotti.  It was good, but I could barely touch it because it was so full from the appetizers.  I did take it home and I ate it for lunch the next day.   They were very generous on the cheese.  That's awesome because I really love cheese!    My husband ordered the chicken marsala.  I didn't try it all, but I snuck in a taste of the mushroom sauce. Mmm!  Our server was so attentive the entire night.  We were there with our Aunt and Uncle and between the four of us we devoured 3 baskets of their crusty bread.  (I told you it's good.). I loved how the servers were so willing to bring out more for us.  Excellent customer service.  Generous food portions.  Flavorful comfort food.  Il Posto has it all.

Tonight we were craving Italian and decided to give this place a try. I am so glad we did our dinner was exactly what I wanted.   We shared the fettuccini alfredo with broccoli and the chicken piccata. Both were excellent and huge portions.   Our kid had the penne with marinara and he was also pleased. Which is great because he is picky!   The owner stopped by our table to make sure we were enjoying our food and I really appreciated how genuinely nice he was. We will be back and we will tell everyone who will listen what a great experience we had at Ziggy's il Posto.   Thank you for the wonderful dinner.

Have been eating here for years, and sad to say every time we come back the service gets a little bit worse and the food quality or lack of availability of certain dishes gets worse as well. The Fra Diavlo appetizer calamari was very rubbery, a shame cuz the sauce was very good and kind of spicy. The arugula salad with apples that we ordered, came with really no arugula. It was nothing more than stems and look like a bunch of weeds in our salad. We sent it back and they comped it for us. We have had it many times before and it was delicious . Our server was very nice, told us that she work there three days a week, yet did not know anything about the menu, anything about the special that night or had no idea what the bar had to offer for cocktails and or beers! If it wasn't for the amazing ambience of the patio and the fact that we have had amazing meals here before, I do not know if I would return. We might try it one more time in hopes the food, service or any combination will be better.  Shame..this was my lil hidden gem back in the day....They need to train their staff and get back to the quality they used to have.  Miss it!!

One of Moon Valley's secrets, this place is definitely a great place for dates! Great food and wine, reasonably priced, friendly staff, food prepared to your satisfaction, very flexible with menu and ingredients. everything is made fresh and tastes wonderful.

I have come to this place a handful of times over the years beginning when it used to be called "Our Gang.". I have always liked the feel of the place & the chicken piccata. I have taken different friends there, dates there before I met my husband, and no matter who I have gone with,have always had a pretty positive experience.  That said, last night I went there with my husband, immediate family, and best friend to celebrate my birthday. There were 6 of us. This time I ordered a simple spaghetti & meatballs.  I was surprised that I did not really like it.  I gave 1/2 the meal to my brother to eat after and 1 of the 2 meatballs to my dad.  I was also really surprised at the response we received when we asked for more bread.  We had eaten 2 small baskets each with a single little loaf of sliced bread, and when we asked if we could have more, the server said, "I'm not sure. How many have you had?" I thoughts he was kidding. But we were told we could have 1 more loaf of bread but after that we'd be charged $2.50 for each additional loaf.  What a crappy policy.  I guess everyone else liked their food ok so I gave them 3 stars. Also my husband. Enjoyed a bottle of wine for a great deal because it was a Weds. special they always run.
Had a group dinner there last night and the food, service and atmosphere were all top notch. The owner, Ziggy, spent time at our table giving us all a great experience. Go there and enjoy!

Traveling from out of town a group of 12 stopped in on a busy Saturday night looking for pizza. What we were treated too was more then we could ever have expected. Ziggy personally set us up in The Grotto, a private room in the back. He treated us like family. The kids got pizza but the entrees sounded to good to pass up so we all got something different and shared. Top quality, delicious, fresh food. We will make this a regular stop on our visits to Phoenix.

I woke up this morning with Il Posto on my mind and garlic on my breath.   We've driven past Il Posto many times en route to visiting a friend who lives in the area, but hadn't taken the opportunity to stop in. Last night, that changed.   As part of a large group of about 20, I was concerned there would be too much confusion over drinks and food orders. Such was not the case. Our servers were prompt and attentive and were able to remember our names. Amazing! The bread and pesto they start you with is great. Even better was the insane amount of garlic they use. The bruscetta was wonderful. The NY Spinach White Pizza was out of this world!!   Our one friend is moving out of this area of town, but we'll be back for Il Posto.

A few months ago I drove by my favorite, remind me of back east wonderful Pizza place, and cried when I noticed it was gone. After sitting down and crying with a few friends who loved the place too, we moved on with plenty of grief mgt and support. Today I was thrilled to go here and learn it is the same owners and same place, just a new name. I am back in heaven!  Tonight I tried something different, a caprese salad pannini. It came with home made potato chips. ( Always a plus-yum) and greens to boot (Because you know your body needs those vitamins) The meal was great. I ordered a side servng of an Italian sausgage( My weakness and hard to find good in Az)  One was enough to feed 4. A little spicy and good. The only thing I did not care about was the sauce it was served on. I come from a place where sauce is called gravy and I like sauce thick not thin. But hey, I did not expect the sausage to have any sauce on it so no big deal to me. It was delish!I ended with Tiramusu, always a nice ending. I went home with a 20 extra pounds on my hips and in leftover doggie bags. AHHHHH sweet heaven!

Ate ouside next to the fire, very quaint facade trying to give you the feel of eating in Italy.  Ordered the Baked Ziggy (Ziti) with Sausage. The sausage is probably one of the best sausage that I have ever had. Good generous portion of pasta and sausage. I ate all the sausage that night but could not eat all the pasta. The next day I ate the leftover, but was not the same without the sausage.  Nice little restauant, would like to try the pizza next time.
